Item 2.02 Results of Operations and Financial Condition

On November 2, 2023, Apple Inc. (the "Company") issued a press release announcing its financial results for the fourth quarter ended September 30, 2023. A copy of the press release is furnished as Exhibit 99.1 to this Current Report on Form 8-K.

The information contained in this Current Report on Form 8-K, including the exhibit, is being furnished pursuant to Item 2.02 and shall not be deemed to be "filed" for purposes of Section 18 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "Exchange Act"), or otherwise subject to the liabilities of that section.

Exhibit 99.1 - Press Release

Apple Reports Fourth Quarter Results

CUPERTINO, CALIFORNIA November 2, 2023 â€” Apple today announced financial results for its fiscal 2023 fourth quarter ended September 30, 2023. The Company posted quarterly revenue of $89.5 billion, down 1 percent year over year, and quarterly earnings per diluted share of $1.46, up 13 percent year over year.

"Today Apple is pleased to report a September quarter revenue record for iPhone and an all-time revenue record for Services," said Tim Cook, Apple's CEO. "We now have our strongest lineup of products ever heading into the holiday season, including the iPhone 15 lineup and our first carbon neutral Apple Watch models, with Apple Watch Series 9 and Apple Watch Ultra 2."

"Our record September quarter Services revenue of $22.3 billion was up 16 percent year over year, with September quarter records in multiple Services categories," said Luca Maestri, Apple's CFO. "We returned nearly $25 billion to shareholders during the quarter as we maintain our target of reaching a net cash neutral position over time."

Quarterly Highlights

  • iPhone revenue was $43.8 billion, up 3 percent year over year
  • Services revenue was $22.3 billion, up 16 percent year over year and an all-time record
  • Mac revenue was $7.6 billion, down 34 percent year over year
  • iPad revenue was $6.4 billion, down 10 percent year over year
  • Wearables, Home and Accessories revenue was $9.3 billion, down 3 percent year over year

Apple's board of directors has declared a cash dividend of $0.24 per share of the Company's common stock. The dividend is payable on November 16, 2023 to shareholders of record as of the close of business on November 13, 2023.
